items.title: The Humbug's Albums of 2025
items.summary: This year has been ups and downs for me to be honest, but music has always been there to save the day so in this…
items.content_html:
This year has been ups and downs for me to be honest, but music has always been there to save the day so in this special article from the humbug post, I'd like to go through some of my favourite releases this year, so here they are in no particular order!

(Just some ones from independent folks, there's obviously some albums I love this year that are more popular but they're already popular so, yeah lol.)

 

Am I in Trouble? - Spectrum

Label: Bölverk Collective / Negative Wingspan
Artwork: Eva Darron / Factotum Design Co.

Now, let me start by saying, I listen to no metal at all, I listen to more punk rock stuff. But this was the album I saw getting promoted most around the time when I joined Ampwall (which Ed Herbers made me aware of when I used to release as METHEWS! Yeah, that far back!) I never even listened to the singles which I'm not sure is a good idea, but I done it anyway and forked out money for a cassette tape from Negative Wingspan which I do not regret! This album was my gateway into metal and I would not have it any other way! It's an amazing record that was a decade in the making and really shows Steve Wiener's amazing creativity creating these tracks with beautiful instrumentation along with amazing collaborations.

An album that I feel anyone can enjoy.

 

Voidscan - Tired Monster

Label: SHIFT+CTRL Music
Artwork: Maria Forsberg

Tired Monster is my perfect electronic album, it's amazing and so easy to listen to. It's a calmer electronic album that I feel kinda borrows some elements from ambient and trap. It's got some amazing sounds that just let me relax and is amazing for working, chilling or doing random tasks (like writing these posts!) The remix album that accompanied it is also incredible, having a story written by the wonderful Vern Carson. Tired Monster is an album that I think is accessible for everyone.

 

Exit Chamber & Ed Herbers - SELF-

Label: Passed Recordings
Artwork: Exit Chamber & Ed Herbers

SELF- brings such an incredible kind of concept to the table. It's that kind of thing that makes you want to reflect on yourself and who you are as a person, at least for me. It also makes me think of people around me, like on the bus, in the town and everywhere else I go. You think about them and who they might be, it's an interesting thing about us as people.

It's an incredible dark ambient album, and what I'd argue is the best one I've heard. It's a collaboration between two artists I love that feels like the ambient supergroup we needed.

 

Dr. Mocker - Constant Current Stimulus

Label: Negative Wingspan
Artwork: Unknown Artist

Constant Current Stimulus is arguably the most experimental little rock album I've heard this year, it has these spacey atmospheres with these interesting sounds which really brings it together with it's amazing instrumentation and vocals.

A very unique release that feels impossible to describe, but is so incredible.

 

lua beach - demo disc: 2024-2025

Label: SHIFT+CTRL Music
Artwork: lua beach

I don't care if this is technically just a "demo compilation" this is one of the best things I've heard in a while. This project of Niki Blackwell is a really amazing one that makes incredibly chill songs that are almost reminiscent of the Minecraft music discs in a way.

It takes chill music and just flips it to be so much more interesting.

items.title: The Worldwide Music Coding Session - BeatDJ Multiplayer
items.summary:
It's a program made for microtonal improvised music and live performance. It's incredibly innovative in the world of DAWs in my own opinion and it's a super interesting project.

In this article, we're focusing on the efforts of the community in the world of multiplayer in BeatDJ.
items.content_html:
It's a program made for microtonal improvised music and live performance. It's incredibly innovative in the world of DAWs in my own opinion and it's a super interesting project.

In this article, we're focusing on the efforts of the community in the world of multiplayer in BeatDJ. 

How Multiplayer Works

In BeatDJ, any user using the program can create a multiplayer room via running the command room c and then selecting if it is going to be a private room or not and giving it a name/description.

Then they can do option A) participants of the multiplayer session can go to soniare.net/multiplayer where they can select the room they want to join from the webpage.

After that point, you get assigned a pre-picked name where you can then type commands that'll come through onto the user's BeatDJ client. Along with this, they'll get these little photos of the session that they can see, although you're not actually going to get live audio or video from here.

And then option B) in your BeatDJ client you run the command room j <roomcode> which then lets you input the commands into your BeatDJ client directly instead, although you don't get the occasional picture of the session. 

It's also good to note that Croft has stated that he thinks using the website to join the multiplayer sessions is better as it's easier and has a guide on the site to help newcomers as well, also that it's just as good as multiplayer in the app.

Once you join the room you then need to get the host to stream their live audio/video via Screen Share. Officially, BeatDJ's community do this via Discord since the Multiplayer is hosted and organized into their Discord server. Although they also suggest Zoom, but really you can use any platform that supports screen sharing reliably.

Then that's it! You're officially BeatDJ'in with others! You officially done a Beat as a cool programming DJ with some new pals.

Who Does Multiplayer Involve?

Now you may wonder, who is the average multiplayer participant? Well to that answer, anyone! Anyone is encouraged to try out BeatDJ and get right cracking in to the action with the experienced community and admins.

This is including people worldwide that have joined BeatDJ Multiplayer, people from Russia, the States, the United Kingdom (England and Scotland), Australia and more have joined in the multiplayer sessions!

Really, you don't need to know everything or be amazing with the software. I was and still very much am in the beginner/intermediate stage of my knowledge in the software but people have joined BeatDJ recently and immediately went into Multiplayer got tips and managed to crack on and do their own thing and experiment with their peers. It's a true representation of an amazing community.

Soniare Collective

The Soniare Collective is the official multiplayer collective from the company. They have multiplayer sessions every Wednesday at 11PM GMT and every Saturday at 8PM GMT hosted via the official Soniare/BeatDJ Discord Server.

Typically, each session will last a couple of hours with around three songs made. These all get put into a spreadsheet that has tracks with the admin's ratings and a sort of genre description so when they organize compilations they know what to pick.

And, that's what we're gonna talk about now!

Soniare Collective officially releases compilations on Bandcamp and streaming services, although Croft has went against submitting them to streaming giant Spotify due to their recent policies that aren't artist friendly, a stance that many bands and artists have been reasonably taking recently.

The first compilation release would go out on August 1st, 2025. The compilation would be called "Afterlight Atlas" and feature mainly and the concept of it was mainly meant to revolve around the idea of as they put it "mental, astral, or cosmic location[s]" with the song being the accompanying soundtrack. The genre is trance/breakcore/electronica.

It's a very interesting album that would introduce you to the world of these tracks.

Along with the normal release of the compilation, there's also a DJ Mix version of the album officially available from Soniare:

They'd end up releasing "Groove Admins" as well on October 1st in the same year. The idea of this album seems to be computers and that kind of Hollywood move computer stereotype which is really fun. This album has more of the groovy dance type tracks which makes a really danceable album which is perfect with the title.

Then finally, the latest release "Wonky Woods" that came out October 31st, which is more wonky, oddtempo, experimental music which really does get you questioning about the tracks but they're certainly amazing!

The Soniare Collective is also certainly organized as they again, have a spreadsheet with the songs they've made, the style/genre, rating from admins and the artists involved!

Along with this, in their Discord they've shared plans for albums going up to February 2026! Which along the way would be meditation music down to techno! 

My Experience Personally With Multiplayer

My first experiences with BeatDJ in general was a random program I had found via the Gribbleschnift Discord server, that day I checked it out and eventually created my own little Twitch stream and made what is now "Deep Slate, Error State" which is still not officially released but you can find it at some places. My friend the perambulator would then show me they had an official Discord server.

I was really stubborn and wouldn't join out of fear of ruining their session/songs even after reassurance. Safe to say, I regretted not joining sooner.

I had an absolute blast learning more about the program, getting to make songs in a unique way and especially with people! It was a surreal experience that somehow connected us out of many different countries which is just how magical the internet can be.

My honest saying is, it's amazing! It helps people learn the software, it helps people find new friends and it helps people work together and make music together which is truly magical.

Nes and Soniare have made something truly amazing here and it shows every time they update it or talk about it.

Thank You!

Thanks for reading this post!

Thought I'd write about a community I was in and got suggested by Nes them self, to make one on the multiplayer of BeatDJ!

I had a lot of fun writing this and getting to talk about this as it's something I am passionate about.

Thank you to Nes! Also can't not thank Magna!

Thanks to all the rest of the BeatDJ community and future team, if you're interested in checking out BeatDJ, you can download it here.

items.title: Caer Sgàil x Petridisch - Chosen Persons (a remix album) - Fan Trivia
items.summary: Heyo! Jude Kerr here, me and Thor (Petridisch) really liked the idea of making a big blog post about the Chosen Persons remix album for you all to be able to read and sip your coffee to.
items.content_html:
Heyo! Jude Kerr here, me and Thor (Petridisch) really liked the idea of making a big blog post about the Chosen Persons remix album for you all to be able to read and sip your coffee to.

Anyway, without further we do! Here is the Chosen Trivia, is that a good name?

#1

The EP art is a picture inside the hall of my house in Wishaw, Scotland. The lamp was a recent little purchase from my maw and it's meant to resemble an astronaut. I sent six photos over for ideas one of them being this photo here:

The photo was quite recently taken on this shitty little camera I bought from a charity shop on Main Street and was playing around with and snapped a photo of the lamp, unaware that it would spark the album cover.

Before that I had this photo taken with the same camera at The Golden Fry of my sister reading something I think? Anyway, I told Thor I didn't like it and he agreed it was too busy.

#2

Petridisch has said that his remix titles for this album are directly influenced by the 80's work of Mixmaster Phil Harding and PWL Records 12" versions.

#3

Petridisch heard Caer Sgàil for the first time on August 16th from me promoting the Error Prone Records issue of It's The People We Choose on cassette tape (and he bought one the day he heard it!).

That very same day he'd ask if there is any remix space for It's The Remixes We Choose where I'd have to sadly turn him down and tell him that all space has been taken and the EP was finished. That would ultimately lead to me offering the full EP to him which I love that we got something out of it because I absolutely love Chosen Persons and can't imagine a world without it.

#4

The vantage point of the back cover of Chosen Persons is not unknown to Petridisch (or his work for that matter). The particular view of the Boston skyline from his apartment porch has featured in some form or another on at least two other projects of his. He truly believed he was getting unique views every time.

#5

During the making Petridisch kept having to remind me the name of the album is "Chosen Persons" as I kept incorrectly calling it "Chosen Personas". Imagine an alternate universe Caer Sgàil that ended up having that as the album name haha.

#6

The limited edition 2025 cassette tape release features two tracks:

A. Chosen Persons (Continuous Album Mix)
B. Moon Cycles

"Moon Cycles" came from when Petridisch sent me the photo of the mock-up "Side B" of the tape and I made a comment because he sent me the image but flipped and make a little joke out of the idea that it's also a reversed version which was exactly what he'd do!

It sounds oddly good? Which is funny to me but I love it!

The track name for Side B is not even named on the tape or anywhere! This is your first official source saying this.

Original title ideas were

  • snosreP nesohC (Jude)
  • Up the Hill Backwards (Petridisch - inspired by David Bowie)
  • Mooncircles (Petridisch)

The name "Moon Cycles" is inspired by the album art! The art is a picture of an "Astronaut" lamp, which is the main inspiration for me to pitch the "Moon Cycles" name. It is inspired by the art also the fact that Moon Cycles (or phases) are a very real thing that influence tides and Earth's stability through gravity, and affect biological rhythms in many organisms, such as triggering reproduction and migration.

Moon cycles also influence Earth’s tides and help stabilise the planet’s tilt, which keeps our seasons and climate steady.

Thank You!

That's all our facts (for now!) We hope you enjoy the Chosen Persons album and continue to support both Caer Sgàil and Petridisch.

Grab Chosen Persons on Ampwall!

Follow Caer Sgàil and Petridisch on Ampwall.

Check out more of Fish Prints' label releases on Ampwall.
